abstract.p: Ann Powers reviews soundtrack album from movie Charlie's Angels (S)

block.p: ''CHARLIE'S ANGELS: MUSIC FROM THE MOTION PICTURE'': Various artists (Columbia Records). America agreed on one truism this month: women can be heroines and still maintain great wardrobes. Part street-feminist fable, part 1970's nostalgia trip, the hit film version of ''Charlie's Angels'' offers a Hollywood version of women's liberation with comic flair. The soundtrack, supervised by the film's director, McG (who started in music videos), manages its contradictions with a similar smirk.

The lead single, ''Independent Women Part 1'' by Destiny's Child, is fast becoming the new ''Ghostbusters'': nonsensical out of context, it is catchy enough to make listeners not care. The trio's other track drags more but still sports that patented blend of sensuality and nastiness. Aerosmith offers a rocker, not a ballad, thank Bosley. Predictable ravers from Fatboy Slim and Apollo Four Forty and a beach-blanket novelty number from Caviar (formerly Fig Dish) round out the originals.

The soundtrack, supervised by the film's director, McG (who started in music videos), manages its contradictions with a similar smirk.

The lead single, ''Independent Women Part 1'' by Destiny's Child, is fast becoming the new ''Ghostbusters'': nonsensical out of context, it is catchy enough to make listeners not care. The trio's other track drags more but still sports that patented blend of sensuality and nastiness. Aerosmith offers a rocker, not a ballad, thank Bosley. Predictable ravers from Fatboy Slim and Apollo Four Forty and a beach-blanket novelty number from Caviar (formerly Fig Dish) round out the originals.

As for the oldies, Marvin Gaye sounds just great, and the hard rock of Heart rekindles respect. Otherwise, the soundtrack boasts music you love to be embarrassed to love. ''Baby Got Back,'' Leo Sayer, and ''Brandy (You're a Fine Girl)'' (with an ear-splitting introduction from Tom Green) can be embraced only with a belly laugh. That's what makes the album work: like the film, it finds the punch in feminine charm.
